GV.name: Govern
GV.description: The organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy are established, communicated, and monitored.

GV.GV.name: Governance - Governance
GV.GV.description: Organizational cybersecurity strategy is established and communicated
controls: GV.GV-01: Organizational cybersecurity strategy is established
GV.GV-02: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are coordinated and aligned
GV.GV-03: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements are understood and managed
remediation: Establish clear cybersecurity governance framework for Azure applications
Define roles and responsibilities for application registration management
Document compliance requirements for application permissions

GV.RM.name: Governance - Risk Management
GV.RM.description: Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
controls: GV.RM-01: Risk management processes are established and managed
GV.RM-02: Risk appetite and risk tolerance statements are established
GV.RM-03: Cybersecurity risk management processes are integrated
remediation: Implement risk assessment framework for application permissions
Define risk appetite for different permission levels
Establish approval workflows for high-risk permissions
Integrate application risk management with organizational processes

GV.RR.name: Governance - Risk Strategy
GV.RR.description: Risk response strategies are established and managed
controls: GV.RR-01: Risk response actions are established and prioritized
GV.RR-02: Risk responses are selected, communicated, implemented, and monitored
remediation: Develop risk response strategies for different permission scenarios
Implement monitoring for high-risk application permissions

GV.PO.name: Governance - Policy
GV.PO.description: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established, communicated, and enforced
controls: GV.PO-01: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established and communicated
GV.PO-02: Cybersecurity policy is reviewed and updated
remediation: Establish Azure application registration security policies
Define permission assignment policies and procedures
Implement regular policy review cycles

GV.OC.name: Governance - Oversight
GV.OC.description: Senior leadership monitors cybersecurity risk and receives updates
controls: GV.OC-01: Cybersecurity-related outcomes are communicated at senior levels
GV.OC-02: Cybersecurity performance and effectiveness are monitored
remediation: Establish executive reporting for application security metrics
Implement dashboards for permission risk monitoring

ID.name: Identify
ID.description: The organization's current cybersecurity posture is understood to manage cybersecurity risk to systems, people, assets, data, and capabilities.

ID.AM.name: Identify - Asset Management
ID.AM.description: Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition
controls: ID.AM-01: Inventories of hardware managed within the organization are maintained
ID.AM-02: Inventories of software and applications are maintained
ID.AM-03: Organizational communication and data flows are mapped
ID.AM-04: External information systems are catalogued
remediation: Maintain inventory of all Azure application registrations
Document data flows and integrations for each application
Catalog external systems that applications connect to
Implement automated asset discovery for application permissions

ID.RA.name: Identify - Risk Assessment
ID.RA.description: Risk assessments are performed to identify cybersecurity risks to organizational operations
controls: ID.RA-01: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented
ID.RA-02: Threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources
ID.RA-03: Threats are identified and documented
ID.RA-04: Potential business impacts and likelihoods are identified
remediation: Conduct regular risk assessments for application permissions
Monitor threat intelligence related to Azure application attacks
Document potential impact of compromised applications
Assess likelihood of permission abuse scenarios

ID.IM.name: Identify - Improvement
ID.IM.description: Cybersecurity risk management processes are improved by incorporating lessons learned
controls: ID.IM-01: A baseline configuration is established and maintained
ID.IM-02: The response to identified cybersecurity incidents is improved
remediation: Establish baseline security configurations for applications
Learn from security incidents involving application permissions

ID.BE.name: Identify - Business Environment
ID.BE.description: The organization's mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood
controls: ID.BE-01: Business functions, processes, and activities are understood
ID.BE-02: Dependencies and critical functions are understood
remediation: Document business functions supported by each application
Identify critical dependencies and single points of failure

ID.GV.name: Identify - Governance
ID.GV.description: The organizational approach to cybersecurity risk management is understood
controls: ID.GV-01: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are established
ID.GV-02: Cybersecurity activities are governed by policies and procedures
remediation: Define clear roles for application security management
Establish governance procedures for permission grants

ID.SC.name: Identify - Supply Chain
ID.SC.description: Supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to
controls: ID.SC-01: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for suppliers are identified
ID.SC-02: Cybersecurity requirements are integrated into supplier contracts
remediation: Assess third-party integrations and their security requirements
Include cybersecurity requirements in vendor contracts

PR.name: Protect
PR.description: Safeguards to ensure delivery of critical infrastructure services are implemented.

PR.AC.name: Protect - Access Control
PR.AC.description: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities is limited to authorized users, processes, and devices
controls: PR.AC-01: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited
PR.AC-02: Physical access to assets is managed and protected
PR.AC-03: Logical access to assets and associated facilities is managed
PR.AC-04: Access permissions and authorizations are managed
PR.AC-05: Network integrity is protected
PR.AC-06: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials and asserted in interactions
PR.AC-07: Users, devices, and other assets are authenticated
remediation: Implement least privilege principle for application permissions
Use conditional access policies to restrict application access
Enable multi-factor authentication for administrative access
Regularly audit and review application permissions
Implement just-in-time access for privileged operations
Use managed identities where possible to avoid credential exposure

PR.AT.name: Protect - Awareness and Training
PR.AT.description: Personnel are provided cybersecurity awareness education and training
controls: PR.AT-01: Users are informed and trained
PR.AT-02: Privileged users understand their roles and responsibilities
remediation: Train developers on secure application registration practices
Educate administrators on permission risk implications
Provide security awareness training on application threats

PR.DS.name: Protect - Data Security
PR.DS.description: Information and records are managed consistent with organizational risk strategy
controls: PR.DS-01: Data-at-rest is protected
PR.DS-02: Data-in-transit is protected
PR.DS-03: Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition
PR.DS-04: Adequate capacity to ensure availability is maintained
PR.DS-05: Protections against data leaks are implemented
remediation: Encrypt sensitive data accessed by applications
Implement data loss prevention for application integrations
Classify data based on sensitivity and restrict access accordingly
Monitor data access patterns for anomalies
Implement data retention policies for application logs

PR.IP.name: Protect - Information Protection Processes
PR.IP.description: Security policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used
controls: PR.IP-01: A baseline configuration is created and maintained
PR.IP-02: A System Development Life Cycle to manage systems is implemented
PR.IP-03: Configuration change control processes are in place
remediation: Establish secure baseline configurations for applications
Implement secure development lifecycle practices
Use infrastructure as code for consistent deployments

PR.MA.name: Protect - Maintenance
PR.MA.description: Maintenance and repairs of organizational assets are performed
controls: PR.MA-01: Maintenance and repair of assets is performed using approved tools
PR.MA-02: Remote maintenance is approved, logged, and performed in a secure manner
remediation: Use approved tools for application maintenance and updates
Secure remote access for application administration

PR.PT.name: Protect - Protective Technology
PR.PT.description: Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security of assets
controls: PR.PT-01: Audit/log records are determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed
PR.PT-02: Removable media is protected and its use restricted
PR.PT-03: The principle of least functionality is incorporated
PR.PT-04: Communications and control networks are protected
remediation: Enable comprehensive audit logging for all application activities
Implement network segmentation for application traffic
Use application firewalls and security controls
Monitor and analyze security logs continuously

PR.AA.name: Protect - Authentication and Authorization
PR.AA.description: Access to assets and associated facilities is limited to authorized users, processes, and devices
controls: PR.AA-01: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited
PR.AA-02: Identity and credential management systems are protected
PR.AA-03: Users are authenticated prior to access
PR.AA-04: Devices are authenticated prior to access
remediation: Implement strong identity and access management
Use certificate-based authentication where appropriate
Regularly rotate application credentials and secrets
Implement device-based conditional access policies

DE.name: Detect
DE.description: Activities to identify the occurrence of a cybersecurity event are implemented.

DE.AE.name: Detect - Anomalies and Events
DE.AE.description: Anomalous activity is detected and the potential impact is understood
controls: DE.AE-01: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows is established
DE.AE-02: Detected events are analyzed to understand attack targets and methods
DE.AE-03: Event data are collected and correlated from multiple sources
DE.AE-04: Impact of events is determined
remediation: Establish baseline behavior patterns for applications
Implement anomaly detection for unusual permission usage
Correlate security events across multiple applications
Assess impact of security events on business operations

DE.CM.name: Detect - Continuous Monitoring
DE.CM.description: The organization continuously monitors to identify cybersecurity events
controls: DE.CM-01: Networks and network communications are monitored
DE.CM-02: The physical environment is monitored
DE.CM-03: Personnel activity is monitored
DE.CM-04: Malicious code is detected
DE.CM-05: Unauthorized mobile code is detected
DE.CM-06: External service provider activity is monitored
DE.CM-07: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed
remediation: Monitor application network traffic and API calls
Implement real-time monitoring for privileged operations
Monitor user activities within applications
Detect suspicious application behavior patterns
Monitor third-party service integrations
Alert on unauthorized access attempts

DE.DP.name: Detect - Detection Processes
DE.DP.description: Detection processes and procedures are maintained and tested
controls: DE.DP-01: Roles and responsibilities for detection are well defined
DE.DP-02: Detection activities comply with applicable requirements
DE.DP-03: Detection processes are tested
DE.DP-04: Event detection information is communicated
DE.DP-05: Detection processes are continuously improved
remediation: Define roles for security monitoring and incident detection
Ensure detection processes meet compliance requirements
Test and validate security monitoring capabilities
Establish communication channels for security alerts
Continuously improve detection based on lessons learned

RS.name: Respond
RS.description: Activities to take action regarding a detected cybersecurity incident are implemented.

RS.RP.name: Respond - Response Planning
RS.RP.description: Response processes and procedures are executed and maintained
controls: RS.RP-01: Response plan is executed during or after an incident
RS.RP-02: Response procedures are updated
remediation: Develop incident response procedures for application security events
Create playbooks for common application security scenarios
Regularly update response procedures based on new threats

RS.CO.name: Respond - Communications
RS.CO.description: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders
controls: RS.CO-01: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed
RS.CO-02: Incidents are reported consistent with established criteria
RS.CO-03: Information is shared consistent with response plans
RS.CO-04: Coordination with stakeholders occurs consistent with response plans
RS.CO-05: Voluntary information sharing occurs with external stakeholders
remediation: Train personnel on incident response roles and procedures
Establish clear incident reporting criteria and processes
Share threat intelligence with relevant stakeholders
Coordinate with cloud providers during security incidents
Participate in industry threat sharing initiatives

RS.AN.name: Respond - Analysis
RS.AN.description: Analysis is conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities
controls: RS.AN-01: Notifications from detection systems are investigated
RS.AN-02: The impact of the incident is understood
RS.AN-03: Forensics are performed
RS.AN-04: Incidents are categorized consistent with response plans
remediation: Investigate all security alerts related to applications
Assess the business impact of security incidents
Preserve forensic evidence for analysis
Categorize incidents based on severity and impact

RS.MI.name: Respond - Mitigation
RS.MI.description: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event and mitigate its effects
controls: RS.MI-01: Incidents are contained
RS.MI-02: Incidents are mitigated
RS.MI-03: Newly identified vulnerabilities are mitigated or documented
remediation: Implement containment procedures for compromised applications
Disable compromised credentials and revoke permissions
Apply security patches and mitigations promptly
Document and track vulnerability remediation

RS.IM.name: Respond - Improvements
RS.IM.description: Organizational response activities are improved by incorporating lessons learned
controls: RS.IM-01: Response plans incorporate lessons learned
RS.IM-02: Response strategies are updated
remediation: Update response procedures based on incident lessons learned
Improve security controls based on attack patterns
Enhance monitoring capabilities after incidents

RC.name: Recover
RC.description: Activities to restore any capabilities or services that were impaired due to a cybersecurity incident are implemented.

RC.RP.name: Recover - Recovery Planning
RC.RP.description: Recovery processes and procedures are executed and maintained
controls: RC.RP-01: Recovery plan is executed during or after a cybersecurity incident
RC.RP-02: Recovery procedures are updated
remediation: Develop recovery procedures for application security incidents
Test backup and restore procedures for applications
Document recovery time objectives for critical applications
Regularly update recovery procedures based on lessons learned

RC.IM.name: Recover - Improvements
RC.IM.description: Recovery activities are improved by incorporating lessons learned from current and previous events
controls: RC.IM-01: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned
RC.IM-02: Recovery strategies are updated
remediation: Update recovery procedures based on incident experiences
Improve backup and restoration strategies
Enhance business continuity planning for applications

RC.CO.name: Recover - Communications
RC.CO.description: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties
controls: RC.CO-01: Public relations are managed
RC.CO-02: Reputation is repaired after an incident
RC.CO-03: Recovery activities are communicated to stakeholders
remediation: Develop communication plans for security incidents
Manage stakeholder communications during recovery
Coordinate with legal and compliance teams as needed
